gurmukhi: ਸੁਨੇ ਬਿੱਪ ਬੋਲੰ ੳੁਠਯੋ ਅਾਪ ਰਾਜੰ ॥
transliteration: Soune Bipp Bolan Outhyo Aap Raajan||
translation: Hearing these words of the Brahmin, the king stood up.

gurmukhi: ਤਜਯੋ ਸਰਪ ਮੇਧੰ ਪਿਤਾ ਬੈਰ ਕਾਜੰ ॥
transliteration: Tajyo Sarap Medhan Pitaa Bair Kaajan||
translation: He abandoned the serpent-sacrifice and enmity for the death of his father.

gurmukhi: ਬੁਲਯੋ ਬਯਾਸ ਪਾਸੰ ਕਰਯੋ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਚਾਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Bulayo Byaas Paasan Daryo Mantra Chaaran||
translation: He called Vyas near him and began consultations.
Vyas was the great scholar of Vedas and the learning of Grammar.11.179.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨੀ ਪਤ੍ਰਕਾ ਦੁੲਿ ਗ੍ਹਿੰ ਕਾਸਿ ਰਾਜੰ ॥
translation: The king had heard that she king of Kashi had two daughter;
Who were most beautiful and splendour of society.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਣੳੁ ਜਾੲਿ ਤਾ ਕੋ ਹਣੋ ਦੁਸਟ ਪੁਸਟੰ ॥
transliteration: Jinau Jaae Taa Ko Haano Doust Poustan||
translation: He wanted to go there in order to conquer them after killing the mighty tyrant.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਯੋ ਪਿਅਾਨ ਤਾਂ ਨੇ ਲਦੇ ਭਾਰ ੳੁਸਟੰ ॥੧੨॥੧੮੦॥
transliteration: Daryo Piaan Taan Ne Lade Bhaar Oustan||12||180||
translation: He then left (for that city) with loaded camel.12.180.
The army moved towards the east like swift wind.

gurmukhi: ਚੜੇ ਬੀਰ ਧੀਰੰ ਹਠੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਪਾਨੰ ॥
transliteration: Chade Beer Dhderan Hathe Sastra Paanan||
translation: With many heroes, enduring the resolute and weapon-wielders,

gurmukhi: ਦੁਰਯੋ ਜਾੲਿ ਦੁਰਗੰ ਸੁ ਬਾਰਾਣ ਸੀਸੰ ॥
transliteration: Duryo Jaae Dudgadg Su Baaraan Seesan||
translation: The king of Kashi concealed himself in his ciadel,

gurmukhi: ਘੋਰਿਓ ਜਾੲਿ ਫੳੁਜੰ ਭਜਿਓ ੲੇਕ ੲੀਸੰ ॥੧੩॥੧੮੧॥
transliteration: Gherio Jaae Phaujan Bhajio Ek Eesan||13||181||
translation: Which was besieged by the army of Janmeja; he meditated only on Shiva.13.181.

gurmukhi: ਮਚਯੋ ਜੁੱਧ ਸੁੱਧੰ ਬਹੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਘਾਤੰ ॥
transliteration: Machyo Juddh Suddhan Bade Sastra Ghaatan||
translation: The war began in full swing, there were many slayings with weapons;
And the heroes, cut into bits, fell in the field.
